results.title: With Nang & Nakorn in Thailand
results.creator_credit: Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Gail Singer
results.brief_description: Shows the activities of tow boys in the village of Con May in Thailand, including catching fish and lizards with their bare hands. The film also notes the building of a traditional Thai house on stilts, and highlights religion, extended family relationships and their use of technology.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions, David Springbett, Heather MacAndrew and Gail Singer

results.title: With music ring
results.brief_description: Featuring the Mormon Tabernacle Choir of 375 voices. Shows how the building of a great composite sound such as the Mormon Tabernacle Choir requires hard work and a man of talent on the podium.

results.title: With Michael in Kyuso, Kenya
results.creator_credit: Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions, David Springbett and Heather MacAndrew
results.brief_description: Focuses on the life of a young boy living in a village in Kenya. Shows the role of education, the links between the village and the towns and the impact of technology on employment prospects in the village.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions, David Springbett and Heather MacAndrew

results.title: With Love to the Person Next to Me
results.creator_credit: Standard Films, John Cruthers and Brian McKenzie
results.brief_description: A comical study in urban alienation and taxi etiquette. Wallace is a taxi driver who lives in a St. Kilda flat with a cast of walking wounded neighbours, all of whom are chronically disconnected like him. He drives the cab at night and spends his days making cider and listening to tapes of the conversations he records secretly in the cab. Those tapes are his only real contact with the world and they allow Wallace to connect with other people’s misery. Cast includes Kim Gyngell, Sally McKenzie, Paul Chubb, Barry Dickens and Daniel Scharf
results.title_for_label: With Love to the Person Next to Me

results.title: With just a little trust
results.brief_description: An elderly black woman, her feet swollen with arthritis, marches with pride and determination through an urban ghetto to meet her daughter. Arriving ahead of her daughter, she finds an eviction notice on the door of the apartment - only the beginning of a veritable sea of troubles which mother and daughter meet together. Cast: Frances Williams, Barbara Iley.

results.title: With inertia
results.brief_description: A stylish exploration of life, death, friendship, drugs, work and unemployment. Five girls living in the city and on the edge, their fast and not so fast lives.

results.title: With hand and heart
results.creator_credit: United States Information Service (Seoul, Korea) and Yang Seung Ryong
results.brief_description: Story of a Korean amputee, hopelessly depressed after losing his arms in the Korean War and fully dependent upon his family; his rehabilitation after he enters the Amputee Centre in Taejon, sponsored and financed by the American Church World Service, where he is given artificial arms and therapy leading to restoration of faith in himself. Finally he attends the Rural Institute where he is taught improved farming techniques.
results.creator_credit_for_label: United States Information Service (Seoul, Korea) and Yang Seung Ryong

results.title: With gentle majesty
results.brief_description: This film recalls the hey-day of the working horse at the turn of the century, and reflects on the decreasing number used today. The title is from Shakespeare’s lines: “Sometimes he trots, as if he told the steps, with gentle majesty and modest pride”. Narrated by Wynn Roberts. (Award: AFI Silver Award)

results.title: With Burning Patience
results.creator_credit: Von Vietinghoff Filmproduktion (VVF), Prole Film, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Antonio Skarmeta
results.brief_description: A film of impassioned charm tracing the lives of little people caught up in large events. A haunting poetic drama which blends Chilean history at the time of the downfall of the Allende government in 1973, with a delicate village love story.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Von Vietinghoff Filmproduktion (VVF), Prole Film, Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen and Antonio Skarmeta

results.title: With Bernadette in Papua New Guinea
results.creator_credit: Asterisk Film and Videotape Productions, David Springbett and Heather MacAndrew
results.brief_description: Focuses n the life of a young girl living in a village in Papua-New Guinea. Shows the customs of the people living the village, the schooling system, the working of garden plots, and the communal effort of the villagers constructing buildings such as an extension for the school.
